transparency.title: How is this calculated?
transparency.subtitle: This is how we calculate the result in plain language.

step1.title: Step 1: 50% rule
step1.text: Requested weekly hours / regular weekly hours = {{part}} / {{full}} = {{pct}} %
step1.fail: Not allowed (< 50%). The calculation stops here.

step3.title: Step 3: Individual base duration
step3.text: Standard duration {{fullM}} − reduction {{redM}} = {{rawBase}} → minimum duration {{minM}} ⇒ basis = {{basis}} months ({{basisYM}}).

step1.title: Step 1: Subtract your reduction
step1.text: Take the normal full-time duration and subtract your reduction months. The result is the reduced full-time duration.

step2.title: Step 2: Find the factor
step2.text: Divide your part-time hours by the full-time hours. This gives you the part-time factor.
step2.example: Example: 30 hours divided by 40 hours = factor 0.75.

step3.title: Step 3: Calculate the part-time duration
step3.text: Divide the reduced full-time duration by the factor and round to whole months.

step4.title: Step 4: Show the difference
step4.text: Compare the part-time duration with the reduced full-time duration to see if it is longer or shorter.

error.below50: The requested weekly working time is below 50% of the regular working time. Please check your entries.
